abstract: A stronger renminbi would not be a quick fix for our problems, but it is crucial to correcting the global economy’s imbalances, David Leonhardt writes in The New York Times.
snippet: A stronger renminbi would not be a quick fix for our problems, but it is crucial to correcting the global economy’s imbalances, David Leonhardt writes in The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: From David Leonhardt’s latest column in The New York Times:

headline.main: Leonhardt: The Long View of China’s Currency
